title: Bodegas Barón NV Xixarito Pasada en Rama Sherry (Manzanilla-Sanlúcar de Barrameda)
description: This full-bodied Manzanilla's pine and stone fruit aromas are lively and precise. On the palate, dry citrus and apricot flavors roll out nicely over a firm and balanced finish.

title: Brandborg 2014 Bradley Vineyard Pinot Noir (Elkton Oregon)
description: Firm and tart, this is anchored by black cherry fruit, with strong coffee and cola highlights. Give it a long sniff and you'll detect a slightly funky note. Drink soon.

title: Brian Carter Cellars 2014 Opulento Dessert Wine Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is a blend of 57% Touriga Nacional, 29% Sauzao, 9% Tinta Cao and 5% Tinta Roriz. Its vanilla, purple fruit and barrel aromas lead to sweet, balanced fruit flavors that persist into the finish.

title: Carlton Hill 2015 Estate Tournament Reserve Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Smoke and coffee aromas float above this four-barrel reserve. In the mouth, it's still compact, with tart cherry and black olive flavors and astringent tannins. It spent 18 months in 30% new French oak and seems built for at least a decade of life ahead.

title: Carobbio 2014  Chianti Classico
description: A savory Sangiovese-based wine, with 5% Merlot, this boasts aromas of violet, moist earth and black-skinned berry. The juicy palate offers succulent Marasca cherry, licorice, white pepper and clove alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Monte da Caçada Red (Alentejano)
description: This rich blend brings out the sunny character of the Alentejo, showing up in warm textures and ripe black fruit. Wood aging and swathes of generous fruitiness have produced a full-bodied wine ready to drink from 2019.

title: Casa Setaro 2015 Munazei White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)
description: Honey, pear crushed stone and nut aromas follow over to the crisp structured palate along with a tangy saline note. Savory and elegant, it has good body and nice length.

title: Castagnoli 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this boasts earthy aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and leather. The savory palate delivers Marasca cherry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2023.

title: Castello della Paneretta 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this presents mouthwatering aromas of black-skinned berry, chopped herb and cooking spice. The juicy medium-bodied palate offers ripe Marasca cherry, licorice, clove and a hint of vanilla alongside dusty tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Castro de Pena Alba 2012 Duvalley Red (Douro)
description: Now ready to drink, this is a big wine, but one that is balanced, stylish even. Great black fruits and licorice and spice flavors are balanced within a framework of generous tannins and acidity. Drink this wine now.

title: Castro de Pena Alba 2012 Quinta do Serrado Touriga Nacional (Dão)
description: In its home territory of the Dão, Touriga Nacional reveals its wonderful perfumes and takes nourishment from the granite soil to bring out minerality and structure. Although this wine has aged as long as it needs, it is still firm, packed with dense structure as well as fruit. Drink now.

title: Domaine des Terrisses 2016 L'Orée du Domaine des Terrisses Duras (Gaillac)
description: Old vines and wood aging lend structure to this single-varietal wine from the Terrisses estate. It's rich, made entirely from the local Duras grape, giving spice, bright black-currant fruit and good acidity. Drink from 2019.

title: Dusted Valley 2014 V.R. Special Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This blend from Dionysus and Stone Tree vineyards offers ripe blackberry jam, black plum, nougat and barrel spice aromas. They're followed by a full-bodied palate rich with velvety tannins. There's no mistaking the warmth of the vintage, though its hedonistic style brings appeal.

title: Famille Laplace 2016 Odé d'Aydie  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
description: This white wine, which comes from the same vineyard region as Madiran's red Tannat, is crisp while ripe. Its blend of the two Manseng grapes offers hints of apricot and honey, even though the wine is dry. Weight at the end gives final dense richness. Drink the wine now.

title: Fiuza 2015 Eminente Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: This well-balanced wine is ripe with black fruits and soft with rounded tannins. It has a smoky, perfumed character along with touches of eucalyptus from the oak aging. The wine is immediately attractive, generous and ready to drink.

title: Flanagan 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Bennett Valley)
description: Tightly wound layers of woody cassis, cherry and cedar combine nicely around a robust midpalate in this hearty full-bodied wine, pronounced in tannin and oak. A floral finish of violet sparks a bright, lingering finish.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2014 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Mixed with small amounts of Syrah and Petite Sirah, this is aged in both French and American oak, and it shows a richly woven palate of grainy leather, tobacco and cedar. The ripe succulent fruit is jammy in blackberry and dark chocolate.

title: Garzón 2016 Reserva Tannat (Uruguay)
description: A dark purple color and lush blackberry, cassis and woodspice aromas open this full-bodied Tannat. Toasty oak graces its core blackberry flavors, creating coffee and chocolate notes. On the finish, it's peppery, full and textured. Drink through 2020.

title: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Château Léret Monpezat Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: This wine offers plenty of structured tannins that are paralleled by the succulent black fruits. The texture is dusty, the tannins dry but very much integrated with the fruit. This wine could be drunk young, say from 2019, but will also age. Drink ideally from 2022.

title: Global Wines 2016 Cabriz Reserva Branco Encruzado (Dão)
description: This is a beautiful wine, impressively bringing out the rich, creamy, yellow- and white-fruit flavors of Encruzado. A great value, it's ripe, lightly herbal and ready to drink.

title: High Valley Vineyard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)
description: This well-balanced wine from high-elevation Lake County has everything in the right proportions: fresh herb and citrus aromas, lip-smacking, crisp fruit flavors, a generous texture and lingering finish.

title: Hoopes 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Sanguine and crisp in cranberry, currant and violet aromas, this wine is bright, expansive and integrated in oak, with accents of cedar and graphite. The full-bodied ripeness holds its own.

title: Ilaria 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From vineyards in St. Helena, Atlas Peak and Howell Mountain, this is a well-made, relatively restrained wine, smoky and earthy up front. Broadly structured, it features fine highlights of black currant and pencil lead and will work nicely at the table.

title: Iota Cellars 2015 Whole Cluster Pelos Sandberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Whole cluster fermentation brings this wine's juicy fruit flavors front and center. Like an especially fine Beaujolais, it pushes ripe berry notes into the spotlight and finishes with drying, tea leaf tannins. It was aged 11 months in one quarter new French oak.

title: Jean-Luc Baldès 2015 Clos Triguedina Malbec du Clos Malbec (Cahors)
description: Although this is pure Malbec, the wine is generous rather than structured. It sings of ripe tannins and warm blackberry fruits. The wine shows off the fruity side of the grape, meaning it will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Jessie's Grove 2016 Sin So Cinsault (Lodi)
description: An elegant, almost delicate wine, it has floral and cherry-like aromas, delicious cherry and pomegranate flavors and a gentle texture with good acidity and very light tannins.

title: Lange 2015 Mia Mousseux Méthode Champenoise Brut Rosé Sparkling (Dundee Hills)
description: A first for Lange, this 75% Pinot Noir and 25% Chardonnay bubbly is elegant and bone dry, with a pleasant earthy character that suggests loess and chalk. The fruit flavors are dried apple, gooseberry and grapefruit, with first-rate length and finesse.
designation: Mia Mousseux Méthode Champenoise Brut Rosé

title: Le Vigne 2015 Di Domenico Tannat (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated black plum and slightly sour blueberry aromas met with dried earth and leather on the nose of this wine. The palate is dense and heavily weighted, with an acidity that slowly rises through the soft tannins, carrying flavors of dark fruit and peppery spice.

title: Left Bend 2016 Fiz Nat Rosé of Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: A good pét-nat combines funk, foam and fun with tart fruit and a full body, and this succeeds on all fronts. Cloudy in the glass, this shows aromas of watermelon soda, strawberry, cherry Jolly Rancher and yeast. Albeit focused on primary flavors, the palate is tart with raspberry candy and sour bubblegum, offering quite a voluptuous mouthfeel.

title: Lyric by Etude 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Light on the nose with hints of cranberry, crushed gravel, wet slate and rose petals, this affordable bottling gives a good sense of minerality at a fair price. There's an herbal background to the bright palate, which offers tart pomegranate and hibiscus flavors.
